conclusion: Acceleration corresponds to the slope of a velocity-time graph.
The slope of Car A's curve is declining over time.
The declining slope of Car A’s curve shows its acceleration magnitude is getting smaller.
The slope of Car B's curve is increasingly steep over time.
The increasingly steep slope of Car B’s curve shows its acceleration magnitude is getting larger during the interval 0 → t₁.
Answer: Yes, the magnitude of the acceleration of Car A gradually decreases, while the magnitude of the acceleration of Car B gradually increases.
